intro: Horkelia tilingii, commonly known as the Tiling's horkelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Horkelia tilingii has hairy stems and leaves, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. It is often found in the Sierra Nevada and other mountainous regions of California.
